Evaluation d'un second projet de
            Sedhiou - Senegal

abstracts.cdata!:
The project would encourage farmers in
            the Sedhiou district of Casamance to adopt improved crop and
            livestock production techniques by supplying them with
            inputs, credit and technical assistance. The project would
            carry the 4,150 farm families already participating in the
            first project to higher levels of technology and induce
            3,250 farm families now using traditional farming methods to
            adopt the improved cropping techniques which have proved
            effective under the first project. In addition the project
            would encourage 4,800 families from both groups to take up
            better livestock practices. It would also help strengthen
            cooperatives by management training and by promoting the
            organization of cooperative unions. The project would
            benefit about 7,400 farm families (80,000 people in all),
            representing about 40% of the rural population of the district.
